comment.author: 41311545@N05
comment._content: ORARA: 1,290 grt steamer built at Kinghorn Scotland in 1907 for the North Coast Steam Navigation Company, NSW, plied Coffs Harbour to Sydney route from memory. Requisitioned by the RAN as an auxiliary minesweeper immediately after on the outbreak of WWII in Sept 1939, and commissioned in Oct., the RAN's largest auxiliary minesweeper of the Second World War. Attached to the 20th Minesweeping Flotilla and successfully swept for mines off Wilson's Promontory ahead of the first large Australian and New Zealand troop convoys destined for the Middle East. Paid off from the Navy on May 14, 1944, and returned to her owners the following year. Passed to Chuinese ownership in 1947 and re-named CANTON RIVER. One of a number of photos of her, here: www.flickr.com/photos/41311545@N05/4711352884/in/photolis...
